content.description: This is a great first highball, and it would also be a great place to practice placing pro as a new trad climber.
content.location: This problem is just to the left of "High and Tight". It follows the large crack up to the top of the face.

content.description:
Start on the right-hand side of hangover recovery and avoid the thorny plants. Named for a snake encounter the same day as the FA that could have ended very poorly.

 (Didn't see this line on mountain project and there was no chalk on the holds but feel free to let me know if someone else had climbed it)
content.protection: Pad(s) and an optional spotter. Long pants might help with the thorns.
content.location: This is on the right side of the same boulder as hangover recovery. It can be found by walking directly away from the road to the North-East past the Dark Star boulder about 50 feet.

content.description: This is a really fun highball boulder problem. It's technical, and all of the holds are nice and solid. You could also easily set an anchor from the top and top rope it.
content.location: If you're facing the "Hangover Cure", this route is 50 feet to your left. It is easily noticeable if you walk along The Back Alley for a few minutes.

content.description: This is a great, little overhanging problem. It's been cleaned and the large, juggy holds on it are all solid. I'd recommend this as a good first outdoor problem for any climber making the transition from indoor to outdoor bouldering.
content.location: Start low and to the right on the large shelf. Move slightly left through big shelves and jugs, and then top out in the center of the boulder on a large jug.

content.description: More direct and shortened version of Crab Walk.   Start back on rail move out the same as Crab Walk then continue straight up after grabbing the lip.
Dihedral start on two opposing bumps.  Move out on rail; reach back to opposing rail (set toe hook); go up to lip and exit right and up.
content.protection: A few pads (covering the protruding rock to the back is a good idea).
content.location: Nice little  cave area 20' to the right of Hangover Recovery (34.71534,-98.6728560)

content.description: Start with pocket and small crimp with low foot to the the left, work your way right and then back left for the top out.
content.location: This is on the right side of the same boulder as hangover recovery. It can be found by walking directly away from the road to the North-East past the Dark Star boulder about 50 feet.  Immediately to the right of snake charmer.

content.description: Just like the rest of the Roadside Boulders, this portion has solid granite. It's further back from the road as well, with a nice view of the creek.
